intro: Galium fleurotii var. bretonii, commonly known as Breton bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to western Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
